intro: Lalexia quadrifida, commonly known as the four-leaf clover, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that often appear in sets of four, a trait associated with good luck. The plant produces delicate violet flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Lalexia quadrifida is a low-growing plant that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense mats.
